'''Loudred''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''ドゴーム''' ''Dogohmb'') is a {{type|Normal}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation III]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Whismur}} starting at [[level]] 20 and evolves into {{p|Exploud}} starting at level 40.

==Biology==
Loudred is a purple, bipedal Pokémon with a square build. It has a large mouth with yellow lips and peg-like teeth in each corner. When its mouth is open, its large tongue and throat are visible. Above its prominent mouth is a stubby nose. On top of its head are two short stalks that support its circular ears. The inside of its ears have alternating black and purple rings, but there is only a single black ring on the back. There are yellow stripes on its back in a pattern that resembles sound waves. It has arms with three fingers and short legs with two peg-like toes. On the sole of each foot is a yellow circle.

Loudred is able to shout at high volumes by inhaling, then exhaling using powerful stomach muscles. Additionally, its round ears serve as loudspeakers and it will stomp its feet to build power. Its powerful voice can tip trucks and splinter wooden houses, but it will be temporarily deaf when it finishes shouting. Loudred can be found in {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Cave Pokémon|caves.}}

==In the anime==
===In the main series===
[[File:Mitch Loudred.png|thumb|220px|left|Loudred in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
====Major appearances====
=====[[Recurring wild Pokémon in the anime#Loudred|Loudred (anime)]]=====
Loudred debuted in ''[[AG022|A Hole Lotta Trouble]]'', and appeared multiple times while {{Ash}} and {{ashfr}} were on [[Dewford Island]] until ''[[AG027|A Three Team Scheme!]]''.

=====Other=====
A Loudred kept showing up in ''[[PK12|Gotta Dance!!]]'' whenever the Poké-Baton was activated along with a {{p|Ludicolo}}. Unlike Ludicolo, who seemingly disappeared into thin air every time the Poké-Baton was deactivated, Loudred would stare blankly for a brief time before finally leaving. When the Poké-Baton finally shorted out, Loudred went mad.

A Loudred appeared in ''[[AG066|Exploud and Clear]]'', under the ownership of {{OBP|Guy|AG066}}. When Ash challenged Guy to a Pokémon battle, both Loudred and {{AP|Treecko}} evolved at the same time.

A Loudred appeared in ''[[AG138|Rough, Tough Jigglypuff]]'', where [[Mitch Mitchum]] had caught it because he thought that the Big Voice Pokémon's {{a|Soundproof|Ability}} to be immune to sound-based moves would help him to catch a {{p|Jigglypuff}} for [[Lisa Mitchum|his daughter]]'s birthday.

Loudred appeared in the ''[[SS020|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time & Darkness]]'' and ''[[SS021|Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Sky - Beyond Time & Darkness]]'' as a member of the [[Wigglytuff's Guild|Wigglytuff Guild]].

====Minor appearances====
A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Loudred appeared in ''[[AG159|Off the Unbeaten Path]]'', where it was participating in the [[Pokémon Orienteering]].

A Loudred appeared in ''[[DP088|Camping It Up!]]''.

A Loudred appeared in the Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures short ''{{DL|Hoopa's Surprise Ring Adventures|Wake Up}}''.

A Loudred appeared in ''[[AG091|Lessons in Lilycove]]''.

A Loudred appeared in ''[[PG09|The Scoop]]'', where it was shown working at [[TV Mauville]].
{{-}}

==In the manga==
[[File:Exploud Loudred Hyper Voice Adventures 1.png|thumb|200px|Loudred (Left & Right) in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
A herd of {{p|Whismur}}, Loudred, and {{p|Exploud}} first appeared during [[Magma Admin Courtney|Courtney]]'s attack on {{adv|Ruby}} in the [[Rusturf Tunnel]] in ''[[PS219|What Would You Do for a Whismur?]]''. Their combined {{m|Hyper Voice}} proved useful in clearing the obstacles that blockaded the area.

The Battle Factory rented a Loudred which was stolen by [[Guile Hideout]] in ''[[PS334|The Final Battle VII]]''.

Much later, in ''[[PS426|Softening Up Kakuna]]'', Loudred appeared as one of the Pokémon that {{adv|Platinum}} rented during the {{DL|Battle Frontier (Generation IV)|Battle Factory}} challenge.

Multiple Loudred appeared in [[PS534]].

==Game data==
===NPC appearances===
* [[Pokémon Mystery Dungeon: Explorers of Time and Explorers of Darkness]]: Loudred is a member of [[Wigglytuff's Guild|Wigglytuff Guild]]. Every day, he wakes the player's team up with his loud, booming voice. He also helps with sentry duty - asking the player after graduating from the guild if they wish to participate.

==Trivia==
* All of Loudred's base stats increase by 20 from its {{p|Whismur|pre-evolution}}, and prior to Generation VI, 20 more when it [[Evolution|evolves]] {{p|Exploud|again}}.

===Origin===
Loudred is based on a {{wp|boombox}}, a portable music system that can play music at a relatively high volume.

====Name origin====
Loudred may be a combination of ''loud'' and ''infrared''.

Dogohmb is derived from 怒号 ''dogō'' (angry roar; bellow) and is possibly combined with ''bomb''.
